phrase.item: yes, the story of a man killing his mother because of a small rice container.
The story of a man killing his mother because of a small rice container. We were not born [in the period], we have observed folk story.
How it [the story] goes, we will do tell as we know.
serial
As for the story, there was a mother and her child living together in a house but (it) did not mention the father.
but she had one son.
The son was around 18-20 years old, like
They did not mention the father, but there was the mother and the son living at that house.
But the mother was a midwife.
a midwife
Do you understand the word "midwife"?
They would be
experts for child birth. They say,
in the past, they say
"Mor Tam Yae"
As for when a person gave birth, it would be done at home. It would not be done at the hospital. There would not be a hospital for child birth.
Now, that time was the season for growing rice.
It's rice growing season
this son would work on the rice field.
The mother and the son would (probably) work on the rice field together, (because) in the past, there was no hiring other people.
As for plowing, they plowed the ancient way.
The ancient plowing method includes a plow and buffalos.
[He] plowed, and plowed.
We call it plow "hood" the field
Plow "hood" the field, now
Before we plant the rice in the mud, we must plow to loosen the soil first.
as to prepare for planting but it is not ready yet
The first task down is called plow "hood".
When we begin the first process is called "Tai hood naa"
Now, this mother was a midwife (as a matter of fact).
One faithful day, the son went to plow the field.
He left for plowing early in the morning (when it was still dark).
He was plowing from early morning until it was late morning around lunch time.
The mother, however, did not go deliver lunch to him.
The mother had not gone to deliver lunch. You might wonder what was she were doing?
The mother was tending to someone giving birth.
serial, V2
She was a midwife.
So, she was late.
Yes, she was a midwife.
Now, she tended to someone giving birth until late morning because giving birth took a long while right?, sometimes right?.
serial, V2
They gave birth. She was a midwife who tended to the child birth.
serial, V2
She tended to the child birth, as a result, she was running late.
serial, V2
But if she were to go deliver meal to her son, she would still be worried about the one who was giving birth.
If you did not know how [to give birth on your own], it could result in death, Milntra, as for child birth.
So, she had to go deliver the baby.
serial, V2

In the past, there was no pushed cart, nor anything.
They only carried loads by the shoulder using a long wooden tool. They carried the rice container balancing it with the food.

So she carried everything by the shoulder using a long wooden tool.

She went to meet her son.

It [the resting place] would be up the high ground, under a tree or places like that.
The son was plowing the field.
There was an enactment too.
I have seen they enacted the story.
He had been plowing the field.
Now he was very hungry.
They call it "head-rice" (hangry).
Head-rice was upon [him]. He was angry, the son.
He saw his mother carrying the loads approaching. He said, "Aren't you here already?"
in his mind, he might have thought "I could kill you right now. Why do you come so late?"

She went [to meet him] to the very field, the mother did.
My dear, Tong.
Come, come eat, my child.
I just got here.
I was busy.
"Why are you late?" He scolded his mother.
The rice container is also small.
I am going to kill this bitch.

then he would go eat some rice, he was still hungry.

phrase.item: Today is the day of the death.
Today I will tell a story of old, following the tradition that retells this story from generation to generation.
The story of a man killing this mother.
The story goes (like this). There was an orphan and his mother.
[They] lived with each other, just the two of them.
The orphan and his mother lived with each other, just the two of them.
It was rainy season like it is now, the time [people] would begin farming.
Normally [they] lived together with peace and harmony, as for the child and his mother. Wherever they go
they would help each other get meals and water all the time.
The child was very well-behaved.
He was well-behaved, hard-working.
He was not lazy with doing chores.
Whatever the villagers did, he would also do them.
The villagers raised cows or buffalos, he did too. He was a diligent person, simply put.

work on the rice field.

phrase.item: The term "Supreme Patriarch" refers to someone who is knowledgable, right? Siang Miang
As for Siang, [someone who] was ordained and left the Buddist monkhood. That is, he was ordained young.
Ordiated into young monkhood, from seven years of age until nineteen years of age and left.
They call "Nen", they call "Siang".
If twenty years old, if he were to be ordained as a monk, it must be "Hod". They call "Hod".
He must have left young monkhood, people call him "Siang".
As for "Tid", [someone is] ordained into Buddist monkhood when he is twenty years old
In the past, they call "Brother Tid", "Brother Siang".

phrase.item: Siang Miang
The story
It is an old saying
Now, once there was a lady.
A lady who was a widow whose husband passed away.
[They] hadn't had any children.
Now, their love for each other was the kind of love...
[They] loved each other to death, as for this husband and wife.
[They] had vowed to each other that
If the husband, who has passed away and has been crimated, did not return
did not reborn to be human, [she] would not take another husband in this life. The love..
(Interviewer) How would [she] know if he has reborned as another person?

If [she] were to know, when [he] comes, [she] then asks for his bibliographic details saying who were you? how you been my husband? what were you like? That is, [he] should be able to recall his former incarnation.
There was one city. This one where this lady
This lady, the lady with fragent hair, has beautiful figure.
more beautiful than younger ladies
which [she] was a widow.
Her reputation preceded her. Wherever she went, she would have someone who came to court [her. Whoever came, they, she did talk to them.
Anyone came [to court her], she did not talk to them.
As for her house
As for the house, on that side there are two rooms and there would be a balcony for sitting right?
there is a balcony and then connected to that is an empty space (for utility)

Pəːŋ is a room in a house that is considered most important in Isaan's house. It is a large room enclosed on three side and one side is open or connected to another room. It is the place where ancestor's ashes are stored. It is said that those who are not the owners of that house are not allowed to enter Pəːŋ.
That way is someone's room, and this way is someone else's room.
Now, there was a prince, son of a king of another city, who is a bachelor.

iword.item: วั่นเถาะไป๋

phrase.item: His appearance is beatiful too. He is handsome too.
Having heard the news that there is a widow who was beautiful like (people were saying) "wow, this person is very beatiful"
And so, he came to court [her] by boat. After arrived at the front of her house, [he] then got out [of the boat] to go talk to her.
[He] had his soilder go, had his soilder go up (on to the house) to annouce that [the prince] would come...
(The lady said) "Why have you all come?"
(The soilders said) "We have come to ask the lady to be a royal consort"
which there was a city...
Now, the lady did not agree, [she] did not assent.
(she said) "May you go and tell the prince of yours to go home. I do not want this."
"I will not have another husband, I will not take another husband."
"Unless my husband would come back to life, then I would marry again."
Now, [she/this] made the prince angry

annoucing to the citizens, (gong noises) all around.

phrase.item: "If anyone were able to ask this lady to get married, [the prince] would give [that person] half of his fortune." [He] would give half of the city away.
Because he had gone to court her day in, day out, but [she] wouldn't accept (his courtship).
[He] had run out of capability.
Once [he] ran out of capability, now [he] rang the gong
Now, a guy went to volunteer, to volunteer
"Ah, if anyone could marry this lady, come take [the fortune] right away!" they said.
This fellow, then, went to sign up along with others.
I will be able to succeed in marrying [her].
"Okay, you may try out your capability" he said
After having recieved permission from the king, right?
[he] came
[he] went and bought a boat, as in bought a sailing ship.
[he] bought a sailing ship and filled it with goods and things.
[he] bought squash, cucumber, put them into the ship, and then came sailing.
Before he came, he stopped at a bucher's shop.
[he] went and bought some pork ribs
[he] had roasted the pork ribs, and as for the meat, he ate it.
and then [he] roasted the ribs until it, until all the meat fell out, right?
and then [he] hammered the bones into ashes.
and [the bones] were crushed some, and were not crushed some.
and then a white cloth for wrapping
[he] wrapped the pork ash securely.
Having wrapped the pork ash, [he] then took this pork ash (and) aboarded the ship with (it)
A white cloth, [you] have seen [it] before right? The kind used to store ashes.
[He] sailed along this way
[He] arrived at the house of this renowned lady, and then
And so, [he] docked. It was getting dark. And so [he] docked saying
"Oh, dear lady", he said
"Dear kind lady, I am a merchant coming from another city."
"Today, it is already dark. May I dock my boat in front of your house?"
"Ah, when tomorrow comes, I would continue sailing away because today it is dark."
"Moreover, the rain is falling and the wind is strong", he said
This lady is indeed a gracious person, right? And so, [she] let the merchant dock the boat
docked the boat on the shore. The merchant, then, slept on the boat right there. [He] slept on the boat.
Now, having woken up in the morning, the merchant came to say "dear lady".
"Today, I will go trade towards the south city" he said
and then go trade in the south city
And so, this lady went "ok, I wish you a good luck", right
[he] sailed away.
We don't know if he had really gone trade or not.
Gone there, then around the evening [he] sailed back here again.
[he] sailed back (and) docked there in the same spot.
[he] has a plan.
Now that [he] came and docked in the same spot.
(he said) "dear lady, today the trade wasn't good"

(she said) "alright, suit yourself" right? And so, [he] rested there.
inside the ship on the water there.

phrase.item: [He] observed the lady's routine, seeing what she did everyday.
In the evening, before going to bed this beautiful lady would take her husband's ashes out and say
"Dear husband"
"Dear husband"

saw [her] speaking like that, then [he] too speak.
